Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The present study describes the delayed development of a severe bladder pathology in a susceptible strain of mice ( DBA / 2 ) but not in a resistant strain ( C57BL / 6 ) when both were treated with a single 300 mg / kg dose of cyclophosphamide ( CY ) .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| bladder pathology |
| DBA / 2 |
| C57BL / 6 |

The paragraph mentions "bladder pathology" as a disease entity, and also mentions the strains "DBA / 2" and "C57BL / 6" as susceptible and resistant strains, respectively, in the context of the development of bladder pathology. Therefore, all three entities should be included in the table as "Disease" entities.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with only the entities that clearly refer to "Disease":

| Disease |
| --- |
| bladder pathology |

The entity "bladder pathology" is the only entity in the paragraph that clearly refers to a disease. The other entities mentioned, "DBA / 2" and "C57BL / 6", are mouse strains that are susceptible or resistant to the disease, but they are not diseases themselves.
